Issues.Title: Feature to bind `Router` information to component inputs
Issues.Body:
Adds ability for `RouterOutlet` to bind `Router` information to the routed
component's inputs. This commit also exposes some helpers for
implementers of custom outlets to do their own input binding if desired.

Resolves https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/18967

Edit to add some more color to the "required inputs" / no references / no compiler warning for the inputs:

- Some router data lives entirely in userspace and isn't known until runtime. This includes path parameters and query parameters. Only static `data` or `resolve` items can be known at compilation time.
- We considered requiring that bindings be defined in the `data` or `resolve` of the `Route` definitions. However, this would require developers to set the [runGuardsAndResolvers](https://angular.io/api/router/RunGuardsAndResolvers) option at least to `'pathParamsOrQueryParamsChange'`. This was undesirable from a usability and discoverability standpoint.
- Required inputs are checked by the template type checking. Because these components are created dynamically by the `RouterOutlet`, required inputs cannot be checked by the compiler. This is also true of any other component created dynamically.
- We also considered yet another property on `Route` to define what bindings to set on the component. Similar to the point above, this was much more verbose than desired.
- There might be some compiler magic we could add to do some level of type checking. However, I feel the Router package should be developed in a way that isn't "special". That is, it's a library that doesn't use any private APIs or integrations that aren't available to any library author. This ensures that the capabilities in the Router can always be replicated in an alternate Routing library driven by the community; I think this is an important property to at least have as a goal for the health of community projects.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Feature to bind `Router` information to component inputs" (#49633)

Issues.Title: refactor(core): Prevent reads and writes to signals at certain times
Issues.Body:
* Prevent reads of signals during the notification process. This shouldn't ever be triggered by user code but is more of a preventative for internal misuse. Reading a signal during notification would/could create glitches where the values being read are not updated to reflect the values being updated by the notification.

* Prevent signal writes inside of computed's. These are meant to be derived values and should not have any side-effects like writing new values to other signals

* Prevent signal writes inside of effects by default. Writing to signal values during the execution of an effect can lead to the `ExpressionChangedAfterItHasBeenCheckedError` if writing to signals that represent global state which is read in a parent component. This is mostly just a problem for `OnPush`/`CheckAlways` components, but with signals being new and pure signal components not even available yet, it will be the majority for a long time.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(core): Prevent reads and writes to signals at certain times" (#49631)

Issues.Title: Node Injector Should Be Checked Before Embedded View Injector
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug? core ### Is this a regression? No ### Description ### Current Behavior Within an embedded view created via `viewContainer.createEmbeddedView()` with a custom injector provided, the DI system checks the embedded view injector first before checking the node injector: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/120555a626d66523e46ce01681b11a0f38e3a40a/packages/core/src/render3/di.ts#L396-L419 ### Problem This would cause unexpected results if we are depending on some providers provided in the embedded view. For example, I have a `NodeDirective` which would look for its parent node via the view hierarchy DI system: ```ts @Directive({ standalone: true, selector: '[appNode]', }) export class NodeDirective implements OnInit { @Input('appNode') name?: string; constructor(@SkipSelf() @Optional() public parent?: NodeDirective) {} ngOnInit(): void { console.log(`${this.name} -> ${this.parent?.name}`); } } ``` When this directive is applied in an embedded view and there is a embedded view injector specified, the DI system would firstly try to resolve the `parent` dependency from the embedded view injector with `SKIP_SELF` and `OPTIONAL` flags applied, which would possibly result in an ancestor `NodeDirective` that is outside of the embedded view instead of the real parent `NodeDirective` within the embedded view. ```html
1
2
3
4
``` In this example, `*appEmbeddedView` directly renders the template via `viewContainer.createEmbeddedView()` and provide its own `Injector` as the embedded view injector. It turns out the `parent` dependencies of node 2, 3, and 4 are all resolved to node #1. [Stackblitz demo](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-wv2uu2?devToolsHeight=33&file=src%2Fmain.ts) ### Expected Behavior The DI system should resolve the dependency from the node injector first before turning to the embedded view injector. The embedded view injector should not have a higher priority than the node injector. ### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-wv2uu2?devToolsHeight=33&file=src%2Fmain.ts ### Please provide the exception or error you saw ```true N/A ``` ### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`) ```true Angular CLI: 15.1.0-next.2 Node: 18.15.0 Package Manager: npm 9.5.0 OS: linux x64 Angular: 15.2.4 ... animations, common, compiler, core, forms, platform-browser ... platform-browser-dynamic, router Package Version --------------------------------------------------------- @angular-devkit/architect 0.1501.0-next.2 @angular-devkit/build-angular 15.1.0-next.2 @angular-devkit/core 15.1.0-next.2 @angular-devkit/schematics 15.1.0-next.2 @angular/cli 15.1.0-next.2 @angular/compiler-cli 15.1.0-next.2 @schematics/angular 15.1.0-next.2 rxjs 7.8.0 typescript 4.7.4 ``` ### Anything else? _No response_

Issues.Title: SwUpdate checkForUpdate can run multiple times simultaneously
Issues.Body: ### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug? service-worker ### Is this a regression? No ### Description If you call `SwUpdate.checkForUpdate` multiple times from application code, it is not deduplicated. Each call will do the full manifest fetch, and will attempt to install a new version if applicable, downloading all the assets multiple times. The assets themselves should mostly be cached by the browser, so there aren't excessive actual requests, but it does potentially slow down the SW thread with what should be completely unnecessary processing. This is relevant for our application, as we run a regular background upgrade check on a timer. If a user has many tabs open, we can end up calling `checkForUpdate` multiple times. Ideally, these multiple calls do not actually trigger multiple downloads and updates. note: the builtin `checkForUpdate` calls are all wrapped in the idle scheduler, so they do not have this issue. or, they kind of do, but it doesn't matter as much because they'll run in sequence and the later calls will just fetch the manifest once and do nothing. If this functionality isn't desired, I should be able to make a PR to fix it. ### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug _No response_ ### Please provide the exception or error you saw _No response_ ### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`) ```true _ _ ____ _ ___ / \ _ __ __ _ _ _| | __ _ _ __ / ___| | |_ _| / â–³ \ | '_ \ / _` | | | | |/ _` | '__| | | | | | | / ___ \| | | | (_| | |_| | | (_| | | | |___| |___ | | /_/ \_\_| |_|\__, |\__,_|_|\__,_|_| \____|_____|___| |___/ Angular CLI: 14.2.10 Node: 16.14.2 Package Manager: yarn 1.22.15 OS: darwin arm64 Angular: 14.2.12 ... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms ... language-service, localize, platform-browser ... platform-browser-dynamic, platform-server, router ... service-worker Package Version --------------------------------------------------------- @angular-devkit/architect 0.1402.10 @angular-devkit/build-angular 14.2.10 @angular-devkit/core 14.2.10 @angular-devkit/schematics 14.2.10 @angular/cdk 14.2.5 @angular/cli 14.2.10 @angular/fire 7.4.1 @angular/material 14.2.5 @nguniversal/builders 14.2.3 @nguniversal/express-engine 14.0.3 @schematics/angular 14.2.10 rxjs 7.5.7 typescript 4.8.4 ``` ### Anything else? _No response_

Issues.Title: Lazy loading components without bound Inputs and Outputs
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

core, router

### Description

I am writing a massive Angular application, with over 40 huge discrete components. Given the fact that many are more than 1MB of payload that a client browser needs to download, I want to lazy load as much as possible (within reason of course)

To this end, I needed to make it simple to bind inputs and outputs between things that host lazy content and the lazy-content itself. I also wanted support for making the interface generic enough to work without having to monkey-patch any of the angular core.

Here is my proposed example lazy-loader that is thusofar stable, though I'm sure there are a number of bugs and limitations that I haven't encountered yet.

Given I have a decently stable and working implementation, I wanted to share it with the community.

### Proposed solution

Source of my loader: https://github.com/knackstedt/ngx-lazy-loader

Sample StackBlitz. 
https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-vr4vv7?file=src/app/example-component.html
NOTE: I had to work around an issue with the dynamic import returning an invalid bundle, but it works as described in multiple test applications. This is _only_ an issue in Stackblitz it seems.



### Alternatives considered

I originally used a directive ontop of `<ng-template>` but this approach had multiple issues. I also considered trying to create some injection tokens, but the proposed approach is far simpler in terms of ease-of-use in my opinion.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Lazy loading components without bound Inputs and Outputs" (#49616)

Issues.Title: feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): initial development server for esbuild-based builder
Issues.Body:
When using the experimental esbuild-based browser application builder, the preexisting `dev-server` builder can now be used to execute the `ng serve` command with an esbuild bundled application. The `dev-server` builder provides an alternate development server that will execute the `browser-esbuild` builder to build the application and then serve the output files within a development server with live reload capabilities. This is an initial integration of the development server. It is not yet fully optimized and all features may not yet be supported. SSL, in particular, does not yet work.

If already using the esbuild-based builder, no additional changes to the Angular configuration are required. The `dev-server` builder will automatically detect the application builder and use the relevent development server implementation. As the esbuild-based browser application builder is currently experimental, using the development server in this mode is also considered experimental.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): initial development server for esbuild-based builder" (#24923)

Issues.Title: Compile time is painfully slow
Issues.Body:
### Command

build, serve

### Description

The ng build/serve compilation times of angular dwarf any other bundler/framework I know of and this is a real drag on my team's development time.

I am wondering if there is perhaps a way to just disable type checking or other things that may be large contributing factors to build time, or some sort of alternative being explored?

Can you also explain a little bit about what % the bottlenecks are right now? It would be good to understand things a little better.

### Describe the solution you'd like

A way faster compilation time

### Describe alternatives you've considered

There aren't any, because since the linker change in Angular 13, I can't use a 3rd party bundler anymore.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Compile time is painfully slow" (#24922)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): support CSP on critical CSS link tags
Issues.Body:
Based on https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/pull/24880#pullrequestreview-1347993316. Critters can generate `link` tags with inline `onload` handlers which breaks CSP. These changes update the style nonce processor to remove the `onload` handlers and replicate the behavior with an inline `script` tag that gets the proper nonce.

Note that earlier we talked about doing this through Critters, which while possible, would still require a custom HTML processor, because we need to both add and remove attributes from an element.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): support CSP on critical CSS link tags" (#24903)

Issues.Title: ng serve often caches old component code
Issues.Body:
### Command

serve

### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

14.1.2

### Description

After number of auto-recompilations when running "ng serve" face an issue with cached component - new changes made in IDE doesn't reflect in browser. Component gets cached and even re-run "ng serve" doesn't help. 
Only removing folder ".angular/cache" and then re-run "ng serve" helps. 
In version 14.1.2 didn't see such an issue very often.
In browser I'm using "Disable cache" option always.

Using Angular CLI version: 15.0.5
Angular version: 15.0.4

### Minimal Reproduction

1. Run "ng serve".
2. Change component code.
3. Wait till re-compilation finish.
4. Verify results.
5. If works, repeat steps 2-4 multiple times. After some point component won't get refreshed (will use previous code).


### Exception or Error

_No response_

### Your Environment

Angular CLI: 15.0.5
Node: 16.18.1

This applies to both watch and non-watch modes. ### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>angular/angular</summary>

### [`v16.0.0-next.5`](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/blob/HEAD/CHANGELOG.md#​1600-next5-2023-03-29)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/compare/16.0.0-next.4...16.0.0-next.5)

#### Breaking Changes

##### bazel

-   Several changes to the Angular Package Format (APF)
    -   Removal of FESM2015
    -   Replacing ES2020 with ES2022
    -   Replacing FESM2020 with FESM2022
-   Several changes to the Angular Package Format (APF)
    -   Removal of FESM2015
    -   Replacing ES2020 with ES2022
    -   Replacing FESM2020 with FESM2022

##### common

-   If the 'ngTemplateOutletContext' is different from the context, it will result in a compile-time error.

Before the change, the following template was compiling:

```typescript
interface MyContext {
  $implicit: string;
}

@​Component({
  standalone: true,
  imports: [NgTemplateOutlet],
  selector: 'person',
  template: `
    <ng-container
      *ngTemplateOutlet="
        myTemplateRef;
        context: { $implicit: 'test', xxx: 'xxx' }
      "></ng-container>
  `,
})
export class PersonComponent {
  myTemplateRef!: TemplateRef<MyContext>;
}
```

However, it does not compile now because the 'xxx' property does not exist in 'MyContext', resulting in the error: 'Type '{ $implicit: string; xxx: string; }' is not assignable to type 'MyContext'.'

The solution is either:

-   add the 'xxx' property to 'MyContext' with the correct type or
-   add '$any(...)' inside the template to make the error disappear. However, adding '$any(...)' does not correct the error but only preserves the previous behavior of the code.

##### core

-   -   `entryComponents` has been deleted from the `@NgModule` and `@Component` public APIs. Any usages can be removed since they weren't doing anyting.
    -   `ANALYZE_FOR_ENTRY_COMPONENTS` injection token has been deleted. Any references can be removed.
-   ComponentRef.setInput will only set the input on the
    component if it is different from the previous value (based on `Object.is`
    equality). If code relies on the input always being set, it should be
    updated to copy objects or wrap primitives in order to ensure the input
    value differs from the previous call to `setInput`.

#### Deprecations

##### core

-   `makeStateKey`, `StateKey` and  `TransferState` exports have been moved from `@angular/platform-browser` to `@angular/core`. Please update the imports.

```diff
- import {makeStateKey, StateKey, TransferState} from '@​angular/platform-browser';
+ import {makeStateKey, StateKey, TransferState} from '@​angular/core';
```

-   The `@Directive`/`@Component` `moduleId` property is now
    deprecated. It did not have any effect for multiple major versions and
    will be removed in v17.

##### platform-server

-   `PlatformConfig.baseUrl` and `PlatformConfig.useAbsoluteUrl` platform-server config options  are deprecated as these were not used.

Issues.Title: fix(@schematics/angular): remove compileComponents from component test schematic
Issues.Body:
Note: This is an updated version of #18316 after discussing with @atscott who thought we are now in a place where it could land

`compileComponents` is not necessary when using the CLI (as the templates are inlined) and just adds boilerplate code. So we can remove it from the test schematic and make it independent from `async/await` (only place we would have it in the CLI generated code, and in most Angular apps).

## PR Checklist

Please check to confirm your PR fulfills the following requirements:

## PR Type

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [x] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:

## What is the current behavior?

Tests are generating with `compileComponent` calls that aren't needed with the CLI

## What is the new behavior?

The boilerplate is reduced to only keep what is really necessary

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No

Issues.Title: fix(@schematics/angular): use same property order in standalone AppComponent
Issues.Body:
## PR Checklist

Please check to confirm your PR fulfills the following requirements:

<!-- Please check all that apply using "x". -->

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#-commit-message-guidelines
- [ ] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)

## PR Type

What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [x] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:

## What is the current behavior?

Currently, the standalone `app.component.ts` looks like:
```ts
@Component({
  selector: 'app-root',
  standalone: true,
  templateUrl: './app.component.html',
  styleUrls: ['./app.component.css'], 
  imports: [CommonModule]
})
```
whereas a generated component looks like:
```ts
@Component({
  selector: 'app-user',
  standalone: true,
  imports: [CommonModule],
  templateUrl: './user.component.html',
  styleUrls: ['./user.component.css']
})
```

Note that the imports are not always in the same place.

## What is the new behavior?

The imports are moved to a similar place than in other components.

Note that we could choose the other option (change it in the component template instead of app.component.ts),
but as `app.component.ts` is the most recent, I chose to update this one

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No

<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications below. -->

## Other information

This can replace #24905

Issues.Title: Angular 8: extractcss true leads to PRSSI vulnerability when used application inside iframe with same origin. any option to inline the bundled scss ?
Issues.Body:
### Command

build

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

We host an application, which tries to load an iframe with same origin content has the css built and append to head of the index.html
<link rel="stylesheet" href="styles.3af5d45ea3cb1a3489a3.css">

Threat:
Relative URLs can be dangerous since browser may not determine the correct directory. If the HTML uses path-relative CSS links, it may be susceptible to pathrelative stylesheet import (PRSSI) vulnerabilities. This could allow an attacker to take advantage of CSS imports with relative URLs by overwriting their target file

This suggest to use absolute URLs, since extractCss is default in the upcoming version, how to avoid this issue ?

### Minimal Reproduction

run an application with iframe of Same origin content

### Exception or Error

```text
Relative URLs can be dangerous since browser may not determine the correct directory. If the HTML uses path-relative CSS links, it may be susceptible to pathrelative stylesheet import (PRSSI) vulnerabilities. This could allow an attacker to take advantage of CSS imports with relative URLs by overwriting their target file
```


### Your Environment

```text
ng serve
```


### Anything else relevant?

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Angular 8: extractcss true leads to PRSSI vulnerability when used application inside iframe with same origin. any option to inline the bundled scss ?" (#24904)

Issues.Title: Browserslist is seemingly ignored for polyfills/transpiling
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

compiler

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

No matter what browser versions are entered into the .broswerslistrc, it does not seem to affect the generated .js files. Even in a completely fresh angular project (as generated by `ng new polyfill-test`) and the canonical browserslist (as generated by `ng generate config browserslist`), the generated main.js file contains `??` operators. The default browserslist allows for Firefox 60 (as confirmed by `npx browserslist`), which does not support `??` (https://caniuse.com/mdn-javascript_operators_nullish_coalescing).

Using newer functions (like `Object.fromEntries`) does also not generate the corresponding polyfills.

To my understanding (https://angular.io/guide/build#configuring-browser-compatibility) transpiling down and generating polyfills should work out of the box. This issue has also been independently noticed on Stackoverflow (https://stackoverflow.com/questions/75750874/angular-cli-15-and-browserslist-are-targeting-the-incorrect-ecmascript-version).

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

_No response_

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

_No response_

### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular CLI: 15.2.4
Node: 16.18.1
Package Manager: npm 8.19.2
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 15.2.3
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1502.4

@angular-devkit/schematics      15.2.4
@angular/cli                    15.2.4
@schematics/angular             15.2.4
rxjs                            7.8.0
typescript                      4.9.5
```


### Anything else?

Currently angular.json's scripts section does not support .mjs. Some front end packages such as mermaid 10 has moved to ES modules with .mjs files

Support .mjs in angular.json's scripts.

Import scripts in index.html is a workaround though not elegant.

Issues.Title: fix(material/select): fix VoiceOver confused by ARIA semantics
Issues.Body:
For Select component, fix issues where VoiceOver was confused by the ARIA semantics of the combobox. Fix multiple behaviors:

 - Fix VoiceOver focus ring stuck on the combobox while navigating options.
 - Fix VoiceOver would sometimes reading option as a TextNode and not communicating the selected state and position in set.
 - Fix VoiceOver "flickering" behavior where VoiceOver would display one announcement then quickly change to another annoucement.

Also fix the same issues for Autocomplete component.

Implement fix by doing two things.

First, move the aria-owns reference to the overlay from the child of the combobox to the parent modal of the comobobx. Having an aria-owns reference inside the combobox element seemed to confuse VoiceOver.

Second, apply `aria-hidden="true"` to the ripple element and pseudo checkboxes on mat-option. These DOM nodes are only used for visual purposes, so it is most appropriate to remove them from the accessibility tree. This seemed to make VoiceOver's behavior more consistent.

Fix #23202, #19798
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/select): fix VoiceOver confused by ARIA semantics" (#26861)

Issues.Title: bug(cdk-menu): first menu item is not autofocused when menu is opened by click
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

Don't know

### Description

When the menu trigger is pressed via clicking, the focus stays on trigger instead of going to the first menu item (or menu wrapper). It works as expected when the trigger is pressed via keyboard, and in `mat-menu`.
Although arrow keys would still move focus to menu items, the biggest impact of this issue is that the menu won't close by `Escape`, since it's the trigger that has the focus, not the overlay.


### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Go to https://material.angular.io/cdk/menu/examples
2. Click on the "Click me!" button in one of the last two examples ("Standalone Trigger" ones)
3. Press `Escape`. It won't close the menu, as focus is still on the trigger, not the menu.


### Expected Behavior

Menu should grab the focus, regardless of if trigger is pressed by mouse or keyboard.

### Actual Behavior

Menu does not grab the focus, regardless of if trigger is pressed by mouse or keyboard. Focus remains on the trigger, if it's triggered by mouse.

### Environment

- Angular: 15.2.0
- CDK/Material: 15.2.0
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(cdk-menu): first menu item is not autofocused when menu is opened by click" (#26858)

Issues.Title: bug(cdk-menu): cdkMenu is not positioned correctly if mat.core() is not added
Issues.Body:
### Description

I'm trying to use the Angular CDK. From my understanding Angular CDK should be completly independent as it states [here](https://material.angular.io/cdk/categories): 
> The Component Dev Kit (CDK) is a set of behavior primitives for building UI components

The problem is not the `cdkMenu` is not displayed correctly if `mat.core()` from Angular Material is not included.


### Reproduction

[StackBlitz](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-bbtwfk-klwyhz?file=src/styles.scss)

Steps to reproduce:
1. Click on `Click me` button (the menu is displayed correctly below the button).
2. Comment `@include mat.core();` from `styles.scss`.
3. Click on `Click me` button.

### Expected Behavior

The menu should be displayed in the same way, under the component.

### Actual Behavior

It is displayed in the left edge.

### Environment

- Angular: 15
- CDK/Material: 15
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(cdk-menu): cdkMenu is not positioned correctly if mat.core() is not added" (#26856)

Issues.Title: bug(many): duplicate code for exposing overlays for modals
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

We have duplicated code for logic for exposing overlays to modals. some browsers won't expose the accessibility node of the overlay if there is an `aria-modal` and the live element is outside of it. This method works around the issue by pointing the `aria-owns` of all modals to the live element.

Action item to consider de-duplicating this with the `LiveAnnouncer` and any other occurrences.

Note that the selector here is limited to CDK overlays at the moment in order to reduce the section of the DOM we need to look through. This should cover all the cases we support, but the selector can be expanded if it turns out to be too narrow.

### Reproduction

Search codebase for  TODOS references this issue report.

```
git grep 'TODO(http://github.com/angular/components/issues/26853)'; git grep '#26853';
```

### Expected Behavior

no occurrences

### Actual Behavior

multiple occurrences

### Environment

N/A
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(many): duplicate code for exposing overlays for modals" (#26853)

Issues.Title: bug(Mat-Slider): Max value disregarded while async hook fires
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

When using the mat-slider with an asynchronous event (e.g. timeout or stream callback), with a dynamic `[max]` property, the max property is disregarded in favor of `100` as the max value.

It also seems to debounce events, given how frequently it actually moves the slider thumb. It would be nice to be able to disable this, for smoothing out the animation when using the slider as an adjustable progress bar (think of a Youtube video slider bar)

### Reproduction

1. click on "trigger lifecycle". This starts an async setInterval that increments the [value] provided to the slider.
2. click on "change max". This increases the [max] by 100
3. move the slider to the center, and observe the reported "current value" being ~50, where ~100 would be expected as the max was updated to 200. The output text reports an accurate max value, while the slider is disregarding it.

https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-mid1b8?file=src%2Findex.html,src%2Fapp%2Fexample-component.html,src%2Fapp%2Fexample-component.ts,src%2Fapp%2Fexample-component.css


### Expected Behavior

Dynamic update of [max] such that the current slider position is always a percentage of the current maximum

### Actual Behavior

maximum is defaulted to 100 when there is an async lifecycle hook

### Environment

- Angular: 15.1.2
- CDK/Material: 15.1.2
- Browser(s): Chrome 112.0.5615.20 (Official Build) beta (64-bit)
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): linux x64
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "bug(Mat-Slider): Max value disregarded while async hook fires" (#26844)

Issues.Title: docs-bug(theming-your-components): Custom Mat Card border
Issues.Body:
### Documentation Feedback

When following the guide theming-your-components I can succesfully create a partial scss file to theme my custom implementation of a Card component that should be styled like the Material Card.
For the background I access:
`$background-palette: map-get($color-config, background);
  $background-color: mat.get-color-from-palette($background-palette, background);
  $background-card-color: mat.get-color-from-palette($background-palette, card);
`
So far when the user switches to a dark theme the background color changes like in material cards.
However the border of outlined material cards has a CSS Variable value for its color.
On light themes the value is #e0e0e0 for me. On Dark Themes it is #595959.
The Variable is:  --mdc-outlined-card-outline-color
It would be nice if the docs could explain how I can apply these border color values to my component via the sass theming api / partial _my-comp.component-theme.scss file.

### Affected documentation page

https://material.angular.io/guide/theming-your-components
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "docs-bug(theming-your-components): Custom Mat Card border" (#26847)

Issues.Title: docs-bug(COMPONENT): consistency problem in palette and theme
Issues.Body:
### Documentation Feedback

In your documentation when you talk about "palette" you say "These identifier numbers include 50, and then each 100 value between 100 and 900" and you give an example.
 50: #e8eaf6,
 100: #c5cae9,
 200: #9fa8da,
 300: #7986cb,
 // ... continues to 900
 contrast: (
   50: rgba(black, 0.87),
   100: rgba(black, 0.87),
   200: rgba(black, 0.87),
   300: white,
   // ... continues to 900
 )
);

But later when you talk about theme when you define the primary color OK no problem because you are using a value consistent with your declaration in the palette ($my-primary: mat.define-palette(mat.$indigo-palette, 500)).
But for the accent color there is a problem because the values â€‹â€‹no longer match your palette declaration (define-palette(mat.$pink-palette, A200, A100, A400)) -> what about A200, A100, A400 ?


Moreover why you need to declare in each palette "accent" values if in you theme you declare an accent color with all the hues from 50 to 900 ?

This problem has consequences in the code if you want to manage the light and dark theme with the "new" declaration model (with color in the map).
If you declare a palette without Axxx and try to inject it in the map at the 'color'/'background'
 level you obtain "color: null is not a color" error.
Moreover you can't use SASS custom properties "var(--xxxxxx)" in the palette to manage foreground and bacground !!


### Affected documentation page

https://material.angular.io/guide/theming
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "docs-bug(COMPONENT): consistency problem in palette and theme" (#26845)

Issues.Title: fix(material/core): Use aria-checked for checkbox option
Issues.Body:
The `aria-selected` attribute is applied to pseudo checkboxes within mat-select multiple selection, which creates a visual and semantic discrepancy, as well as causing problems for screen readers that does not announce aria-selected status. This has resulted in a number of accessibility bugs being reported in the past.

It makes more sense to use `role='option'` for single selection mode and `role='checkbox'` for multiple selection mode. For checkboxes, we can use `aria-checked` to mark selection status, and for options, we can use `aria-selected`. Doing this would ensure that all screen readers announce the selection status consistently.

Demo recorded on Chrome + VO with the change, SR announces "selected/not selected" for single selection, and "checked/not checked" for multiple selection.

[Mat-select demo.webm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20229878/228040205-911e5616-8805-4b46-8b57-fcb2ab629320.webm)

---
Demo recorded on Chrome + NVDA with the change, SR only announces "not selected" for single selection, and "checked/not checked" for multiple selection.

[AM-select NVDA.webm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20229878/228340098-ed2a81b1-8cb0-40db-8afa-03f46a6a671c.webm)

---
Demo recorded on Chrome + JAWS with the change, SR does not announce selection status for single selection, and "checked/not checked" for multiple selection.

[AM-select JAWS.webm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20229878/228340511-54ddf67e-d07a-4746-a252-6fe9ee8657c2.webm)

---
Demo recorded on Firefox + NVDA with the change, SR only announces "not selected" for single selection, and "checked/not checked" for multiple selection.

[AM-select NVDA firefox.webm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20229878/228371609-57b584ff-8a5b-45e8-bd6e-03c7bf947a65.webm)

---
Demo recorded on Firefox + JAWS with the change,  SR does not announce selection status for single selection, and "checked/not checked" for multiple selection.

[AM-select JAWS firefox.webm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20229878/228371709-efdf342e-4e22-439a-934e-95c3c2b13ce3.webm)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/core): Use aria-checked for checkbox option" (#26843)

Issues.Title: feat(mat-checkbox): Tristate (false --> true --> indeterminate) option for checkbox
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

I once built a directive (some kind of subclassing) for the mat-checkbox that isn't working anymore since MDC. Now I'm thinking about making it a PR rather than just building my own directive again.

Would this feature be interesting? Was this already discussed? Or is it rather a rare use-case (or not liked from a UX perspective?) and I should stay with my (reworked) directive?

In some cases I want a checkbox to represent three states (e.g. yes / no / no answer). Right now the checkbox control does not allow this by default.

Issues.Title: bug(Mat-Slider): Slider [max] and [min] are not respected.
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

When updating the bound `[max]` property, the input doesn't actually update it's max value, and makes the result emitted by `(dragEnd)` faulty, as it's based on 0-100 instead of the current `max` value.

```
            <mat-slider>
                <input
                    matSliderThumb
                    [min]="0"
                    [max]="duration"
                    [step]=".01"
                    [value]="currentTime"
                    (dragEnd)="media.currentTime = $event.value"
                >
            </mat-slider>
```


### Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-mid1b8?file=src/app/example-component.html

### Expected Behavior

Min puts a minimum-bound to the output value, while max puts a maximum-bound to the output value

### Actual Behavior

Very inconsistent value setting; getting negative values and values that FAR exceed the expected "max" of the slider.

### Environment

- Angular: 15.2.4
- CDK/Material: 15.2.4
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Ubuntu 22.04 (Pop!_os)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "bug(Mat-Slider): Slider [max] and [min] are not respected." (#26839)

Issues.Title: CSS: Need utility classes in Angular Material.
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

As front end architect I want to be minimalistic and optimistic with font-end libraries and framework. Angular is a good framework and it has many capability than any other front-end framework ever. 

Angular material has improved developers productivity and also project timeline as it has very rich component library with rich functionality. 

But the problem is every front end developer need some CSS utility classes with good configuration and typography for their  application. Till now some were using [angualr/flex-layout](https://github.com/angular/flex-layout) and now Angular team is no longer support that library. 

[Tailwindcss](https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss) is a CSS utility based framework but it is not compatible with Angular material.
But we do not want to depend on another library for CSS utility.

**Can Angular team add utility classes for flexbox, gird and other CSS utility in Angular Material itself, So that angular community won't not depend on any other CSS library or framework.**



### Use Case

**Angular Material - Component framework.**

Alternatives are
1. [bootstrap](https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap)   - CSS utility + component framework.
2. [tailwindcss](https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss)  - CSS utility + component framework.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "CSS: Need utility classes in Angular Material." (#26837)

Issues.Title: feat(MatListItem): Should have a color directive
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

It would nice if there was a directive to set the color of mat-list-items and icons.
Overriding the internal CSS of MatListItem is kind of hard and might fail in the future.

I like the padding and would rather not create the whole Mat Line Layout without the existing directives. 

### Use Case

If you want to display a list of error messages you might want to style them to your warn palette color.
MatListItemIcon with an Delete Icon button might also be styled to your warn palette color.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(MatListItem): Should have a color directive" (#26836)

Issues.Title: build: enable update of `@angular/bazel`
Issues.Body:
Enables updating of `@angular/bazel`. We stopped because:

* `@angular/bazel` was updated to no longer produce CommonJS devmode
* It relied on `ts_library` patches to no longer produce CommonJS devmode.

We can make these changes to unblock the update, but it would be a significant effort as all `nodejs_binary` targets would need to be updated to execute ESM natively (as there obviously is no CJS anymore). This is what we did as an experiment in framework to run tests/code natively using `.mjs`. We are not going to do it here as we would rather want to put the effort into switching to a toolchain that supports ESM properly.. without patches.

For now we are just reversing the change in `ng_module` so that it still produces devmode CommonJS. Components repo will not use for tests etc, but it's there to allow for `nodejs_binary` CommonJS targets, and to avoid having to perform a large migration. See all the patches that are needed in framework:
https://github.com/angular/angular/tree/main/tools/esm-interop
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "build: enable update of `@angular/bazel`" (#26834)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-form-field): mat-label incorrectly displayed at init (behavior possible)
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

Sometimes, when the component mat-form-field is initied too fastly, when we use mat-icon with the attribute matPrefix or matSuffix, the mat-label is misplaced only at the init of the entire component.

A possible behavior can be to initialize the mat-form-field  with setTimeout at 100ms or more after the component loaded on ngOnInit().
But, when using ReactiveFormsModule, an error (NG01050: formControlName must be used with a parent formGroup directive) can still be present but the forms works **normally.**

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a mat-form-field
2. Add a mat-label to this one
3. Add a trailling mat-icon with matPrefix or matSuffix


### Expected Behavior

The mat-icon and mat-label must be placed normally, means the icon must be before the mat-label for example.

### Actual Behavior

The label must be placed after the icon for matSuffix but only at init he is misplaced above or below the mat-icon. The mat-label works normally after he is focused.

### Environment

- Angular: Angular 15.0.0
- CDK/Material: 15.2.2
- Browser(s): Brave, Edge
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(mat-form-field): mat-label incorrectly displayed at init (behavior possible)" (#26833)
